name: Rise Volumizing Thermal Hot Brush
categories: Hair, Tools, Hair Straighteners & Flat Irons
about: What it is:A smart hot brush for quick and effortless, three-dimensional volume that lifts your roots and creates body through your lengths..Hair Type:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Texture:Fine, Medium, and Thick.What Else You Need to Know:Give your hair the boost it deserves with twice the volume. Add lift at your roots and create body through your lengths for added shape, bounce, and fullness.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Place brush at roots with your hair on top..-Wrap your hair around the brush twice..-Hold for five to eight seconds, then remove. .-Where the curl stops, wrap in the opposite direction. .-Repeat with the top section. .-Comb the section up and out for height.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is by far the best hair tool I have found for my thinning hair.  I have lost so much of it and didn't want to keep styling it with a blow dryer and round brush or anything that tugs too much, or excessive heat, i.e: first blow dry for volume, then style with curling iron or flat iron, etc.  I tried this and it's been the tool that has replaced everything else.  I still have my blow dryer for when I don't want to style and only dry my hair.  But this has been a game-changer for me.  It gives beautiful volume and is actually pretty versatile when it comes to the curls you want.  You can go from really tight curls to soft gorgeous waves.  The style lasts until I wash and I have tried this on my family relatives who have completely different hair than I do, thicker, thinner, straight, wavy, etc., and it works just as well.  HOWEVER, I will say, it definitely has a learning curve!  You have to get the hang of it and make sure your hair is detangled before going in, otherwise you will snag and tangle your hair and it will be a mess.  There are some tutorials on YouTube that are helpful but, you do have to be somewhat savvy with hair tools.  That's my only complaint because a lot of people will miss out or think this tool is terrible lol  But if you can get the hang of it, it's a staple of a tool.  I've had it for 3 years now and it has lost two teeth but it's nothing detrimental, it still works wonders and I do use it A LOT! On myself and my family.

reviews.review_text: I wish I would have bought it sooner! This product works perfectly on my short, wavy hair to set and refine my style. The style lasts through day 2 for me and looks amazing. I did watch all instructional videos before using it and the method for holding it was already similar to other styling in my routine so holding this hot brush feels easy to me (sort of like using a denman brush and a flat iron at the same time). I also find it works best when paired with the B&B oil primer.

reviews.review_title: new favorite for curling my hair

reviews.review_text: So you really need to give this a chance before reviewing or giving up on the tool. It has taken me at least 6 times to figure out how it works best for my hair. reviews.review_title: For dry hair styling, avoid if you have thick hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Ok I am not the greatest at hair styling, but I did manage to style my hair pretty quickly with this. A few things to know: this is for dry styling, they're not very clear about that. Also, this would not be ideal for very thick hair- it would take forever to style. My hair got caught in it several times and I had to turn the thing off and panic about ripping my hair off before it burned. Twice. I also didn't see great volume at the roots, though more practice could fix that. I used it to style bouncy old hollywood curls and it looks really nice.  I'm probably gonna return it though and get a less expensive curling iron

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this after trying the dyson airwrap and being utterly disappointed by it. I was looking for something to add body to my hair and that would be able to create different styles. The ghd rise delivered beyond my expectations. So far after just my first time playing with it, I was able to create three different looks that were absolutely perfect and so easy to create. Straight with body and a little curl at the end (blowout kind of look), old Hollywood style curls, and the most stunning beach waves. Seriously, it looks better than when my hairstylist waves it! I just hold the ghd rise near the root and wrap it once, then pull and twist down the hair. And every single strand came out perfectly the same. For the old Hollywood curls, comb through from root to tip and roll it back up the hair once you get to the end and hold, then unroll it. And for the straight look, just comb through and give it a flick at the end. Not only did the styles come out nicer than with the dyson or even my traditional curling iron, but they actually held way better, too. Supposedly itu2019s the perfect temperature to get hold while not causing damage to the hair. I mean itu2019s definitely higher heat than the airwrap since thatu2019s just a blow dryer basically, but I didnu2019t feel like my hair was in bad shape after using it. So hopefully thatu2019s true. Seems like it. Plus the airwrap styles took ten years to create then fell out of my hair within ten minutes no joke. As far as it pulling hair out, I didnu2019t experience that whatsoever. It may be a hair type thing. For reference, my hair is fine, long, straight to wavy,  and bleached. All in all, itu2019s the easiest and most versatile hair tool Iu2019ve ever used. Iu2019ve never been able to create these styles as nicely with any other tool.

reviews.review_title: Yes, there is a learning curve. Yes, it's worth it
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have had this thing over a month now. I've watched the tutorials - I've watched the bloggers on youtube - and now I have my thoughts. The first time I used it, I looked a hot mess. There is absolutely a learning curve of about two uses, but it is WORTH IT if you struggle with volume.   The way I use this now, is by blowing out or rough drying my hair, adding a heat protectant, separating my hair, and curling just my ends, which creates a beautiful wave that turns into a bouncy blowout look. I use it at the crown and lift horizontally, hold, and drop back down and the volume is gorgeous. Looks like a lovely salon blowout. The waves you can create are gorgeous too, so it's a multifunctional tool for blowout looks, waves, and/or volume. Try it out, don't give up, don't let the bad reviews sway you and stick with it. So worth.   Also for reference my hair is thin and at my shoulders.

reviews.review_title: Does so much more than the description says!!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I NEVER write reviews but felt the need to chime in on this one. I have long curly/wavy hair and lots of it. My other hot brush died and so I found this looking for a replacement. This brush does so much more than the description says!!! I was a little wary of the price and if it would work like I hoped because I wasnu2019t looking for volume. I had guessed/hoped it would work like this: I used this on my air dried curly hair as I would use a hot brush but handled it like I would a round brush and I am in love!!! It tamed the curl like a flat hot brush but then I was able to add soft curls to the ends beautifully. If you already used round brush to dry, hot brush to tame and curler to finish this replaces all and with minimal learning curve. Note: to only be used on dry hair

reviews.review_text: I m in love totally worth it beautiful bouncy hair

reviews.review_text: i love this hot brush! it gave me a voluminous blow out look that lasted all day! one thing i had to do is watch a few tutorials on how to use this product, as it's not quite like using a wand, and not quite like using a curling iron.  once i perfected my technique it gave me that old school hot roller bounce!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love what this hot brush did for my long thick but fine textured and limp hair.  While it didn't give me the body  at the roots I had hoped (back brushing/teasing did) I loved how it smoothed my frizzy ends and tamed my locks.  It did give me body around my ends and it didn't take away volume like some devices will.  Nothing but back brushing as shown in the video gives me lift at the root.    If I use a flat iron for smoothing my hair as advertised goes completely flat and I lose the bounce I love from the blowdryer.    I have tried many different hot tools and have collect quite the graveyard of unused devices in an attempt to tame my frizzy unmanageable hair without luck.  With the GHD round brush,  I tried doing my hair like in the video, separating it into sections and wrapping the hair around the wand close to the roots but I didn't get the body or structure I wanted.  However to my surprise,  when I simply brushed it around my hair cupping the ends around the wand the results were nothing short of astonishing.   I got the smoothing I desired and a bit of bounce and curl on my ends in mere seconds.  I can fix my hair in way less than 5 minutes with this device.   I would say it takes me about 2 minutes.   The only caveat is that it gets extremely hot and has no thermostat to help you control the heat.   But I don't have to make multiple passes to get the results I want either so I am hoping that I won't get damage because I am going to want to use it daily.   I highly recommend using a  product that protects your hair from heat damage though, but that is always a good idea even if you are only using the blowdryer.  I can't recommend this device enough especially for those with long hair who want to keep that just blowdried bounce or get it back a day later.   I am not a professional or tried it on different types of hair but I have a feeling it will be useful to women with short hair as well.   I am buying one for my daughter today, I am that impressed.

reviews.review_text: I just received my GHD Rise and it is everything that I hoped for.  It is lightweight and easily produces body or curls on my shoulder length hair.  I position it laterally to do the back of my hair.
